Or if you're in the mood for something a bit more recent, I'd recommend "Restless" (2006), a poignant coming-of-age drama featuring Mia Wasikowska and Hayley Atwell as they navigate the ups and downs of young adulthood.

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something a bit more cerebral, "The Baader Meinhof Complex" is a gripping and well-researched film that delves into the complexities of Germany's terrorist past.

I think you might enjoy "Blade Runner"! It's a classic sci-fi film set in 2019 (not too far from your preferred year of 1920) and explores themes of humanity and what makes us, well, human. The movie also features Harrison Ford as the iconic blade runner, Rick Deckard.

If you're interested in something a bit more light-hearted, I'd recommend "Super"! It's an animated film that celebrates imagination and creativity, with a dash of superhero fun thrown in. With a talented voice cast including Ellen Page and Kevin Bacon, it's a great choice if you're looking for something a bit more family-friendly.

(And just to clarify, since there were no German-language films on the list, I didn't recommend "Louie" or "Utsav", which are both non-English language films. Similarly, since Sarah Vowell isn't featured in any of these movies, that was also not a consideration.)
